instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_R: What is SMC_LID_R? SMC_LID_R is the signal coming from the hall sensor that detects whether the laptop screen is closed or open. This must be high in order for SMC_LID to be high. SMC_LID has to be high for the machine to not fall asleep and for it to have a backlight..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2530 going to sleep after the desktop is shown when starting the machine.
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a 820 2530 that goes to sleep right after it shows the desktop, the board came in for a  keyboard connector replacement.
I've changed the connector  and when i start the machine all goes fine until I see the desktop, after that the mac puts himself to sleep, removed the motherboard to inspect if it comes from the new connector and I see that the <CAPACITOR>C9799</CAPACITOR> is ripped off sow I put a new one thinking that was the problem but it does the same thing like before.
Any suggestions on were to start looking?
 
Thank's

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2530 going to sleep after the desktop is shown when starting the machine.
[SOLVED]820 2530 going to sleep after the desktop is shown when starting the machine.
threads.message:
No Title

Thanks Louis,
I've searched where to measure the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and seen on the schematics that  J6955 has the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_R</SIGNAL> on pin 5, no surprise when I see some pins are missing on batterry indicator connector.
Started the mac without connecting it and everything works.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2530 going to sleep after the desktop is shown when starting the machine.
threads.message: You know where to go from here!
